title: The Perilous Journey Into the NBA’s Bargain Bin Grantland » Contributors » Zach Lowe

type_specific.selection: We see Danny Green raining fire and Patrick Beverley strip-searching ball handlers, and we forget all the washed-out draft picks and minimum-salaried free agents who couldn’t maintain a spot in any NBA rotation. This is an NBA version of survivorship bias, the mental glitch where we assume active successes are the norm because they are in front of our faces while the more typical outcomes are in street clothes or the Chinese league.
